intro: Sisymbrium nebrodense, commonly known as the Nebrod Alps mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces a strong, aromatic scent. Sisymbrium nebrodense is often found in alpine and subalpine areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
